title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: This Ordinance may be called the copyright Ordinance, 1962.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: It extends to the whole of Pakistan.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government may, by
notification in the official Gazette, appoint.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "adaptation" means:- ----

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a dramatic work, the conversion of the work into a
non-dramatic work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a literary work or an artistic work, the conversion of
the work into a dramatic work by way of performance in public or
otherwise.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a literary or dramatic work, any abridgment of the
work or any version of the work in which the story or action is
conveyed wholly or mainly by means of pictures in a form suitable
for reproduction in a book, or in a newspaper, magazine or similar
periodical; and

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: in relation to a musical work, any arrangement or transcription of the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"architectural work of art" means any building or structure having an
artistic character or design, or any model for such building o structure;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "artistic" work' means:-

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc: an architectural work of art; and

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: any other work or artistic craftsmanship;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"audio-visual work" means a work which consists of a series of related
images which are intrinsically intended to be shown by the use of a
machine or device, such as a projector, viewer or electronic equipment,
together with accompanying sound, if any, regardless of the nature of the
material object, such as film or tape, in which the work is embodied;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "author" means:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: in relation to a literary or dramatic work, the author of the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: in relation to a musical work, the composer;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: in relation to an artistic work other than a photograph, the artist;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: in relation to a photograph, the person taking the photograph;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a cinematographic work, the owner of the work at the
time of its completion; and

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a record the owner of the original plate from which the
record is made, at the time of the making of the place;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "Board" means the Copyright Board constituted under section 45;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc: "calendar year" means the year commencing on the first day of January;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"cinematographic work" means any sequence of visual images including
video films of every kind, recorded on material of any description (whether
translucent or not), whether silent or accompanied by sound, which, if
shown (played back, exhibited) conveys the sensation of motion;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"copy" includes any material object in which a work is fixed by any
method and from which the work can be perceived, reproduced or
otherwise communicated, either directly or with the aid of a machine or
device;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: any alteration of a trade description as regards the goods or services to which it is applied whether by way of addition. effacement or otherwise where that alteration makes the description untrue or misleading in a material respect

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
counterfeit copy" means a copy which is an imitation of another copy and
appears to be, but is not, genuine;";

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"delivery" in relation to a lecture, includes delivery by means of any
mechanical instrument or by broadcast or telecast;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"dramatic work" includes any piece for recitation, choreographic work or
entertainment in dumb show, the scenic arrangement or acting form of
which is fixed in writing or otherwise but does not include a
cinematographic work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"engravings" include" etchings, lithographs, woodcuts, prints and other 
similar works, not being photographs;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"exclusive license" means a license which confers on the licensee or on the 
licensee and persons authorized by him, to the exclusion of all other 
persons (including the owner of the copyright), any right comprised in the 
copyright in a work and "exclusive licensee" shall be construed 
accordingly;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"Government work" means a work which is made or published by or under 
the direction or control of:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: the Government or any department of the Government; or

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: any court, tribunal or other judicial or legislative authority in Pakistan;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "infringing copy" means,-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a literary, dramatic or artistic work, a reproduction 
thereof otherwise than in the form of a cinematographic work;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a record, any record, embodying the same recording; 
and

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in relation to a programme in which a broadcast reproduction right 
subsists under section 24, a record recording the programme: if 
such reproduction, copy or record is made  or imported in 
contravention of any of the provision of this Ordinance;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "lecture" includes address, speech and sermon;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"literary work" includes works on humanity, religion, social and physical 
sciences, tables "compilations and computer programmes, that is to say 
programmes recorded on any disc, tape, perforated media or other 
information storage device, which, if fed into or located in a computer or 
computer-based equipment is capable of reproducing any information"

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"manuscript" means the original document embodying the work, whether 
written by hand or not;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"performance" includes any mode of visual or acoustic presentation, 
including any such presentation by the exhibition of a cinematographic 
work, or by means of broadcast or by the use of a record, or by any other 
means and, in relation to a lecture, includes the delivery of such lecture;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"performing rights society" means a society, association or other body, 
whether incorporated or not, which carries on in Pakistan the business of 
issuing or granting licenses for the performance in Pakistan of any works in 
which copyright subsists;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"periodical" includes a publication with distinctive title intended to appear 
in successive numbers or in parts at regular or irregular intervals and, as a 
rule, for an indefinite time, each part generally containing articles by 
several contributors;”;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"plate" includes any stereotype or other plate, stone, block, mould, matrix, 
transfer, negative, tape, wire, optical film, or other device used or intended 
to be used for printing or reproducing copies of any work, and any matrix 
or other appliances by which records for the acoustic presentation of the 
work are or are intended to be made;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "prescribed" means prescribed by rules made under the Ordinance;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"radio diffusion" includes communicationto the public by any means of 
wireless diffusion whether in the form of sounds or visual images or both;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"record" means any disc, tape, wire, perforated roll or other device in 
which sounds are embodied so as to be capable of being reproduced 
therefrom, other than a sound track associated with a cinematographic 
work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"recording" means the aggregate of the sounds embodied in and capable of 
being reproduced by means of a record;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"reproduction" in the case by a literary, dramatic or musical work, includes 
a reproduction in the form of a record or of a cinematographic work, and, 
in the case of an artistic work, includes a version produced by converting 
the work into a three-dimensional form, or if it is in three dimensions, by 
converting it into a two dimensional form and references to reproducing a 
work shall be construed accordingly;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"work" means any of the following works, namely: - (i) 
a 
literary, 
dramatic, musical or artistic work; (ii) a cinematographic work; (iii) a 
record;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
"work of joint authorship" means a work produced by the collaboration of 
two or more authors in which the contribution of one author is not distinct 
from the contribution of the other authors; and

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: "work of sculpture" includes casts and models.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
For the purpose of this Ordinance, 
"copyright" means the exclusive right, by virtue of, and subject to, the provisions 
of this Ordinance:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a literary, dramatic or musical work, to do and authorize the 
doing of any of the following acts, namely:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to reproduce the work in any material form;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to publish the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to perform the work in public;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to produce, reproduce, perform or publish any translation of the  
work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to use the mark in a cinematographic work or make a record in 
respect of the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to broadcast the work, or to communicate the broadcast of the work 
to the public by a loudspeaker or any other similar instrument;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to make any adaptation of the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to do in relation to translation or an adaptation of the work any of 
the acts specified in relation to the work in sub-clauses (i) to (vi);

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of an artistic work, to do or authorize the doing of any of the 
following acts, namely;-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to reproduce the work in any material form;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to publish the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to use the work in a cinematographic work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to show the work in television;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to make any adaptation of the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to do in relation to an adaptation of the work any of the acts 
specified in relation to the work in sub-clauses (i) to (iv);

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a cinematographic work, to do or authorize the doing of any 
of the following acts, namely:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to make copy of the work;

title: Preliminary
Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to make any record embodying the recording in any part of the 
sound track associated with the work by utilizing such sound track;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to broadcast the work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a record, to do or authorize the doing of any of the following 
acts by utilizing the record, namely:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to make any other record embodying the same recording;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to use the recording in the sound track of a cinematographic work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
to cause the recording embodied in the record to be heard in the 
public;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc: to communicate the recording embodied in the record by broadcast.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
Any reference in sub-section(1) to the doing of any act in relation to a 
work or a translation or an adaptation thereof shall include a reference to the doing 
of that act in relation to a part thereof.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
Entitlement to copyright in compilation of data or other material shall not 
extent to data or other material itself and shall be without prejudice to any 
copyright subsisting in the data or other material, that is to say, the copyright shall 
subsist to the extent of compilation only.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
For the purposes of this Ordinance, 
"publication" means: -

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work, the issue 
of copies of the work to the public in sufficient quantities;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of cinematographic work, the sale or hire or offer for 
sale or hire of the work or copies thereof to the public;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a record, the issue of records to the public in 
sufficient quantities; but does not, except as otherwise expressly 
provided in this Ordinance, include:-

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of a literary, dramatic or musical work the issue 
of any records recording such work;

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
in the case of work of sculpture or an architectural work of 
art, the issue of photographs and engravings of such work.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
If any question arises under sub-section (1) whether copies of any literary, 
dramatic, musical or artistic work, or records issued to the public are sufficient in 
quantities, it shall be referred to the Board whose decision thereon shall be final.

title: Preliminary
sect_desc:
When work not deemed to be published or performed in  
public
subsec_desc:
Except for the purposes of infringement of copyright, a work shall 
not be deemed to be published or performed in public, and a lecture shall not be 
deemed to be delivered in public, if published, performed in public or delivered in 
public, without the licence or consent of the owner of the copyright.

title: Preliminary
sect_desc: When work deemed to be first published in Pakistan
subsec_desc: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a work published in Pakistan, shall be deemed to be first published in Pakistan, notwithstanding that it has been published simultaneously in some other country, unless such other country provides a shorter term of copyright for such work and a work shall be deemed to be published simultaneously in Pakistan and in another country if the time between the publication in Pakistan and the publication in such other country does not exceed thirty days.

title: Preliminary
sect_desc: When work deemed to be first published in Pakistan
subsec_desc: If any question arises under sub-section (1) whether the term of copyright for any work is shorter in any other country than that provided in respect of that work under this Ordinance, it shall be referred to the Board whose decision thereon shall be final.

title: Preliminary
sect_desc:
Nationality of author where the making of unpublished work is 
extended over considerable period
subsec_desc:
Where in the case of an unpublished work, 
the making of the work is extended over a considerable period, the author of the 
work shall for the purposes of this Ordinance, be deemed to be a citizen of, or 
domiciled in, the country of which he was a citizen or wherein he was domiciled 
during the major part of that period.

title: Preliminary
subsec_desc:
For the purposes of this Ordinance a body 
corporate shall be deemed to be domiciled in Pakistan if it is incorporated under 
any law in force in Pakistan or if it has an established place of business in 
Pakistan.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: No copyright except as provided in this Ordinance
subsec_desc:
No person shall be 
entitled to copyright or any right in any work, whether published or unpublished, 
otherwise than under and in accordance with the provision of this Ordinance, or of 
any other law for the time being in force, but nothing in this section shall be 
construed as abrogating any right or jurisdiction to restrain a breach of trust or 
confidence.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
Subject to the provisions of 
this section and to the other provisions of this Ordinance, copyright shall subsist 
throughout Pakistan in the following classes of works that is to say:-

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc: original, literary, dramatic, musical and artistic works;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc: cinematographic works ; and

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc: records.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
Copyright shall not subsist in any work specified in subsection (1), other 
than a work to which the provisions of section 53 or section 54 apply, unless:-

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of a published work, the work is first published in 
Pakistan, or where the work is first published outside Pakistan, the 
author is at the date of such publication, or in a case where the 
author was dead at that date, was at the time of his death, a citizen 
of Pakistan or domiciled in Pakistan:

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of an unpublished work other than an architectural work 
of art, the author is at the date of the making of the work a citizen of 
Pakistan or domiciled in Pakistan; and

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of an architectural work of art, the work is located in 
Pakistan.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc: Copyright shall not subsist:-

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in any cinematographic work, if a substantial part of the work is an 
infringement of the copyright in any other work;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in any record made in respect of a literary, dramatic or musical 
work, if, in making the record, copyright in such work has been 
infringed.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
The copyright or the lack of copyright in a cinematographic work or a 
record shall not affect the separate copyright in any work in respect of which or a 
substantial part of which, the work, or as the case may be, the record is made.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
In the case of an architectural work of art, copyright shall subsist only in 
the artistic character and design and shall not extend to the process or methods of 
construction.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
Where, in the case of a work of joint authorship, 
some one or more of the joint authors do not satisfy the conditions conferring 
copyright Iaid down by this Ordinance, the work shall be treated for the purposes 
of this Ordinance as if the other author or authors had been the sole author or 
authors thereof:  
Provided that the term of the copyright shall be the same as it would have 
been if all the authors had satisfied such conditions.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Provision as to designs registerable under Act II of 1911
subsec_desc:
Copyright shall not subsist under this Ordinance in any design which is registered 
under the Patents and Designs Act, 1911,

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Provision as to designs registerable under Act II of 1912
subsec_desc:
Copyright in any design which is capable of being registered under the 
Patents and Designs Act, 1911, but which has not been so registered, shall cease as 
soon as any article to which the design has been applied has been reproduced more 
than fifty times by an industrial process by the owner of the copyright or, with his 
license, by any other person.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, 
the author of a work shall be the first owner of the copyright therein: 
Provided that:-

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of a literary, dramatic or artistic work made by the author in the 
course of his employment by the proprietor of a newspaper, magazine or 
similar periodical under a contract of service or apprenticeship, for the 
purpose of publication in a newspaper, magazine or similar periodical, the 
said proprietor shall, in the absence of any agreement to the contrary, be 
the first owner of the copyright in the work in so far as the copyright relates 
to the publication of the work in any newspaper, magazine or similar 
periodical, or to the reproduction of the work for the purpose of its being so 
published, but in all other respects the author shall be the first owner of the 
copyright in the work;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
subject to the provisions of clause (a), in the case of a photograph taken, or 
a painting or portrait drawn, or an engraving or a cinematographic work 
made, for valuable consideration at the instance of any person, such person 
shall, in the absence of any agreement to the contrary, be the first owner of 
the copyright therein;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of a work made in the course of the author's employment under 
a contract of service or apprenticeship, to which clause (a) or clause (b) 
does not apply, the employer shall, in the absence of any agreement to the 
contrary be the first owner of the copyright therein;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of a Government work, Government shall, in the absence of any 
agreement to the contrary, be the first owner of the copyright therein;

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
in the case of a work to which the provisions of section 53 apply, the 
international organization concerned shall be the first owner of the 
copyright therein.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
The owner of the copyright in an existing 
work or the prospective owner of the copyright in a future work may assign to any 
person the copyright either wholly or partially and either generally or subject to 
limitations and either for the whole term of the copyright or any part thereof: 
Provided that, in the case of the assignment of copyright in any future 
work, the assignment shall take effect only when the work comes into existence: 
Provided further that, where the owner of the copyright in a work is the 
author of the work, no assignment of the copyright in the work or of any interest in 
such copyright shall be made, or if made shall be effective (except where the 
assignment is made in favour of Government or an educational, charitable, 
religious or non-profit institution) for a period of more than ten years beginning 
from the calendar year next following the year in which the assignment is made ; if 
an assignment of the copyright in a work is made in contravention of this proviso, 
the copyright in the work shall, on the expiry of the period specified in this 
proviso, revert to the author (who may re-assign the copyright in the work subject 
to the provisions herein contained), or if the author be dead to his representatives 
in interest. 
Provided further that the copyright in an unpublished work assigned by its 
author to any person or organization for the specific purpose of its publication 
shall revert to the author if such work is not published within a period of three 
years from the date of its assignment."; and

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
Where the assignee of a copyright becomes entitled to any right comprised 
in the copyright, the assignee as respects the rights so assigned, and the assignor as 
respects the rights not assigned, shall be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance 
as the owner of copyright and the provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect 
accordingly.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
If the owner of a copyright or the publisher, or the publisher to 
whom such right has been assigned, considers any of the terms of the assignment 
to be likely to affect his interests adversely, he may within one year of such 
assignment apply to the Board to consider such term and the Board may, after 
hearing both the parties, pass such order as it may deem fit; and the order of the 
Board shall be binding on both the parties.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
In this section, the expression "assignee" as respects the assignment 
of the copyright in any future work includes the legal representatives of the 
assignee, if the assignee dies before the work comes into existence.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
subsec_desc:
No assignment of the copyright in any work 
shall be valid unless it is in writing signed by the assignor or by his duly 
authorized.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Transmission of copyright in manuscript by testamentary disposition
subsec_desc:
Where under a bequest a person is entailed to the manuscript of a literary, 
dramatic or musical work, or to an artistic work, and the work was not published 
before the death of the testator, the bequest shall, unless the contrary intention is 
indicated in the testator's will or any codicil thereto, to be construed as including 
the copyright in the work in so far as the testator was the owner of the copyright 
immediately before his death.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Right of owner to relinquish copyright
subsec_desc:
The owner of the 
copyright in a work may relinquish all or any of the rights comprised in copyright 
by given notice in the prescribed form to the Registrar and thereupon such rights 
shall, subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), cease to exist from the date of 
the notice.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Right of owner to relinquish copyright
subsec_desc:
On receipt of a notice under sub-section (1), the Registrar shall cause it to  
be published in the official Gazette and in such other manner as he may deem fit.

title:
COPYRIGHT, OWNERSHIP OF COPYRIGHT AND 
THE RIGHTS OF THE OWNER
sect_desc: Right of owner to relinquish copyright
subsec_desc:
The relinquishment of all or any of the rights comprised in the copyright in 
a work shall not affect any rights subsisting in favour of any person on the date of 
the notice referred to in subsection (1).

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in published literary, dramatic, musical and artistic 
works
subsec_desc:
Except as otherwise hereinafter provided, copyright shall subsist in 
any literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work (other than a photograph) published 
within the life time of the author until fifty years from the beginning of the 
calendar year next following the year in which the author dies. 
Explanation.---- In this section, the  reference  to the  author shall, in the 
case of  a work of joint authorship, be construed as a reference to the author who 
dies last.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in posthumous work
subsec_desc:
In the case of a literary, 
dramatic or musical work or an engraving, in which copyright subsists at the date 
of the death of the author or in the case of any such work of joint authorship, at or 
immediately before the date of the death of the author who dies last, but which or 
any adaptation of which, had not been published before that date, copyright shall 
subsist until fifty years from the beginning of the calendar year next following the 
year in which the work is first published or . where an adaptation of the work is 
published in any earlier year, from the beginning of the calendar year next 
following that year.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in posthumous work
subsec_desc:
For the purposes of this section. a literary, dramatic or musical 
work or an adaptation of any such work shall be deemed to have been published, if 
it has been performed in public or if any records made in respect of the work have 
been sold, or offered for sale, to the public.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in cinematographic works, records and 
photographs
subsec_desc:
In the case of a cinematographic work, copyright shall 
subsist until fifty years from the beginning of the calendar year next following the 
year in which the work is published.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in cinematographic works, records and 
photographs
subsec_desc:
In the case of a record, copyright shall subsist until fifty years from 
the beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which the record is 
published.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in cinematographic works, records and 
photographs
subsec_desc:
In the case of a photograph, copyright shall subsist until fifty years 
from the beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which the 
photograph is published.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
In the 
case of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work (other than a Photograph), 
which is published anonymously or pseudonymously copyright shall subsist until 
fifty years from the beginning of the calendar year next following the year in 
which the work is first published: 
Provided that where the identity of the author is disclosed before 
the expiry of the said period, copyright shall subsist until fifty years from the 
beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which the author dies.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
In sub-section (1), references to the author shall, in the case of an 
anonymous work of joint authorship, be construed:-

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
where the identity of one of the authors is disclosed as 
references to that author;

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
where the identity of more authors than one is disclosed, as 
references to the author who dies last from amongst such 
authors.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
In sub-section (1), references to the author shall, in the case of a 
pseudonymous work of joint authorship, be construed:-
explanation:
For the propose of this section, the identity of an author 
shall be deemed to have been disclosed, if either the identity of the author is 
disclosed publicly by both the author and the publisher or is otherwise established 
to the satisfaction of the Board but that author.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
where the names of one or more (but not all) of the authors 
are pseudonyms and his or their identity is not disclosed, as 
references to the author whose name is not a pseudonym, or, 
of the names of two or more of the author are not 
pseudonyms, as references to such one of those authors who 
dies last;

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
where the names of one or more (but not all) of the authors 
are pseudonyms and  the identity of one or more of them is 
disclosed, as references to the author who dies last from 
amongst the authors whose names are not pseudonyms and 
the authors whose names are pseudonyms and are disclosed 
; and

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in anonymous and pseudonymous work
subsec_desc:
where the names of all the authors are pseudonyms and the 
identity of one of them is disclosed, as references to the 
author  whose identity is disclosed or, if the identity of two 
or more of such authors is disclosed, as references to such 
one of those authors who dies last.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in Government works and in works of international 
organizations
subsec_desc:
Copyright in a Government work shall, where Government 
is the first owner of the copyright therein, subsist until fifty years from the 
beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which the work is first 
published

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Term of copyright in Government works and in works of international 
organizations
subsec_desc:
In the case of a work of an international organization to which the 
provisions of section 53 apply, copyright shall subsist until fifty years from the 
beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which the work is first 
published.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in unpublished work
subsec_desc:
If a work, whose 
author's identity is known, is not publish posthumously within fifty years after the 
death of the author, such work shall fall into the public domain after fifty years 
from the beginning of the calendar years next following  the year in which the 
author dies.

title: TERM OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Term of copyright in unpublished work
subsec_desc:
If a work, whose author's identity is not known, is not published 
within fifty years of its creation, such work shall fall into the public domain after 
fifty years from the beginning of the calendar year next following the year in 
which the work is created.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
Broadcasting organizations 
shall enjoy the right to authorize:-

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc: the rebroadcasting of their broadcasts:

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc: the fixation of their broadcasts; and

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc: the copying of fixations made of their broadcasts.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
This right shall subsist until twenty-five years from the beginning of 
the calendar year next following the years in which the broadcast took place.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
sect_desc: Rights of performers and producers of Phonograms (sound recording)
subsec_desc:
The performers shall have the right to do or to prevent fixation of their 
unfixed performance and reproduction of such fixation and broadcasting by 
wireless means and communication to the public of their live performance.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
sect_desc: Rights of performers and producers of Phonograms (sound recording)
subsec_desc:
The producers of Phonograms shall have the right to do or to prohibit the 
direct or the indirect reproduction of their fixation and any rental thereof

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
sect_desc: Rights of performers and producers of Phonograms (sound recording)
subsec_desc:
The rights specified in subsections (1) and (2) shall subsists for a period of 
fifty  years computed from the end of the calendar year in which fixation was made 
or performance took place

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
sect_desc:
Application of other provisions of this Ordinance to broadcasting, 
performers and producers of phonograms
subsec_desc:
Any person who, without the 
authorization of the broadcasting organization, does or causes the doing of any of 
the acts referred to in section 24 shall be deemed to infringe the rights of the 
broadcasting organization, and the provisions contained in Chapter XII to XVI 
shall, within the limits permitted by the nature of the matter, apply to broadcasting 
organization and broadcasts as if they were authors and works, respectively.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
"broadcast" means communication to the public by any 
means of radio-diffusion, including communication by telecast, or by wire, or by 
both, and "broadcasting" shall be construed according."

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
"rebroadcasting" means the simultaneous broadcasting by one broadcasting 
organization of the broadcast of author broadcasting organization.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
"fixation" means the incorporation of sounds or images or both in a device 
by means of which they can later be made aurally or visually perceivable.

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
“producer of phonogram” means a person who, or the legal entity which, 
fixes the sounds of a performance or other sounds;

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
“rebroadcasting” means the simultaneous broadcasting by one 
broadcasting organization of the broadcast of an other broadcasting 
organization

title:
RIGHTS OF BROADCASTING ORGANIZATIONS PERFORMERS AND 
PRODUCERS OF PHONOGRAMS (SOUND RECORDING)
subsec_desc:
For the removal of doubts, it is hereby 
declared that the rights conferred upon broadcasting organizations shall not affect 
the copyright in any literary, dramatic, musical, artistic or cinematographic work, 
or in any record used in the broadcast.

title: RIGHTS IN PUBLISHED EDITIONS OF WORKS
sect_desc: Protection of typography and terms of protection
subsec_desc:
The publisher of an 
edition of a work shall enjoy the right to authorize the making, by any 
photographic or similar process, of copies, intended for sale in commerce, of the 
typographical arrangement of the edition, and such right shall subsist until twenty
five years from the beginning of the calendar year next following the year in which 
the edition was first published.

title: RIGHTS IN PUBLISHED EDITIONS OF WORKS
subsec_desc:
Any person who, without the authorization of the 
publishers, makes or causes the making of, by any photographic or similar process, 
copies, intended for sale in commerce, of the typographical arrangement of the 
edition or any substantial part thereof, shall be deemed to infringe the rights of the 
publishers, and the provisions contained in Chapters XII to XVI shall, within the 
limits permitted by the nature of the matter, apply to the publisher and the 
typographical arrangements of editions as if they were authors and works 
respectively.

title: RIGHTS IN PUBLISHED EDITIONS OF WORKS
subsec_desc:
For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared 
that subject to the provisions of subsection (2A) of section 10 the rights conferred 
upon publishers by this Chapter shall:-

title: RIGHTS IN PUBLISHED EDITIONS OF WORKS
subsec_desc:
subsists irrespective of the question whether the edition is that of 
work protected or unprotected by copyright;

title: RIGHTS IN PUBLISHED EDITIONS OF WORKS
subsec_desc:
not affect the copyright, if any, in the literary, dramatic, musical or 
artistic work itself.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
sect_desc:
Performing rights society to file statement of fees, charges and 
royalties
subsec_desc:
Every performing right society shall, within the prescribed time 
and in the prescribed manner, prepare, publish and file with the Registrar, 
statement of all fees, charges, royalties which is proposes to collect for the grant of 
licenses for the performance in public of works it respect of which it has authority 
to grant such licenses.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
sect_desc:
Performing rights society to file statement of fees, charges and 
royalties
subsec_desc:
If any such society fails, in relation to any work, to prepare, publish or file 
with the Registrar the statements referred to in sub-sub-section (1) in accordance 
with the provisions of the sub-section, no action or other proceeding to enforce any 
remedy, civil or criminal, for infringement of the performing rights in that work 
shall be commenced except with the consent of the Registrar.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
Any person having any 
objections to any fees, charge or royalties or other particulars included in any 
statement referred to in section 31 may at any time lodge such objections in 
writing at the Copyright Office.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
Every objection lodged, at the 
Copyright Office under section 32 shall, as soon as may be, be referred to the 
Board and the Board shall decide such objection in the manner, hereinafter 
provided.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
The Board shall not withstanding that no objection has been lodged, take 
notice of any matter which, in its opinion, is one for objection.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
The Board shall give notice in respect of every objections to the performing 
rights society concerned and shall give to such society and the person who lodged 
the objection a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
The Board shall, after making the prescribed enquiry, make such alterations 
in the statements as it may think fit, and shall transmit the statements thus altered 
or unchanged, as the case may be, to the Registrar, who shall thereupon as soon as 
practicable after the receipt of such statements, publish them n the official Gazette 
and furnish the performing rights society concerned and the person who lodged the 
objection with a copy thereof.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
The statement of fees, charges or royalties as approved by the Board shall 
be the fees, charges or royalties which the performing rights society concerned 
may respectively lawfully sue for or collect in respect of the issue or grant by it of 
licenses for the performance in public of works to which such fees, charges or 
royalties relate.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
No performing rights society shall have any right of action or any right to 
enforce any civil or other remedy for infringement of the performing rights in any 
work claimed by such society against any person who has tendered or paid to such 
society the fees, charges or royalties which have been approved by the Board as 
aforesaid.

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
Nothing in this Chapter shall be deemed 
to affect:-

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
any rights or liabilities in relation to the performing rights in 
work accrued or incurred before the commencement of this 
Ordinance; and

title: PERFORMING RIGHTS SOCIETIES
subsec_desc:
any legal proceedings in respect of such rights or liabilities 
pending at such commencement.

title: LICENSES
subsec_desc:
The owner of the copyright in any 
existing work or the prospective owner of the copyright in any future work may 
grant any interest in the copyright by license in writing signed by him or by his 
duty authorized agent: 
Provided that in the case of a license relating to copyright in any future 
work, the license shall take effect only when the work comes into existence.
explanation:
When a person to whom a license relating to copyright in 
any future work is granted under this section dies before the work comes into 
existence, his legal representatives shall, in the absence of any provision to the contrary in the license, be entitled to the benefit of the license.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
If at any time 
during the term of copyright in any Pakistani work which has been published or 
performed in public, an application is made to the Board that the owner of the 
copyright in the work-

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
has refused to republish or allow the republication of the work or 
has refused to allow the performance in public of the work and by 
reason of such refusal the work is withheld from the public; or

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
has refused to allow communication to the public by broadcast of 
such work or, in the case of a record the work recorded in such 
record, on terms which the applicant considers reasonable or

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
is dead or is unknown or cannot be traced or found and 
republication of the work is necessary in the public interest; the  
Board, after giving to the owner of the copyright in the work a 
reasonable opportunity of being heard and after holding such 
inquiry as it may deem necessary, may, if it is satisfied that such 
refusal is not in the public interest, or that the grounds for such 
refusal are not reasonable, direct the Registrar to grant to the 
applicant a license to republish the work, perform the work in 
public or communicate the work to the public by radio-diffusion, as 
the case may be, subject to payment to the owner of the copyright 
of such compensation and subject to such other terms and 
conditions as the Board may determine; and thereupon the Registrar 
shall grant the license to the applicant in accordance with the 
direction of the Board, on payment of such fee as may be 
prescribed.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
Where two or more persons have made applications under sub
section (1), the license shall be granted to the applicant who in the 
opinion of the Board, would best serve the interests of the general 
public.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: Compulsory license in work withheld from public
subsec_desc:
The Federal Government or the Board may, upon an application by 
any governmental or statutory institution in the public interest, 
grant a license to reprint, translate, adopt or publish any text book 
on non-profit basis.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
Any citizen of 
Pakistan or a person domiciled in Pakistan may apply to the Board for a license to 
produce and publish a translation of a literary or dramatic work in any Pakistani 
language or a language ordinarily used in Pakistan, not being English, French or 
Spanish

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
Every such application shall be made in such form as may be prescribed 
and shall state the proposed retail price of a copy of the translation of the work.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
Every applicant for a license under this section shall, along with his 
application, deposit with the Registrar such fee as may be prescribed.

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
When an application is made to the Board under this section, it may, after 
holding such inquiry as may be prescribed, direct the Registrar to grant to the 
applicant a license, not being an exclusive license, to produce and publish a 
translation of the work in the language mentioned in the application, on condition 
that the applicant shall pay to the owner of the copyright in the work royalties in 
respect of copies of the translation of the work sold to the public, calculated at 
such rate as the Board may, in the circumstances of each case, determine in the 
prescribed manner; 
Provided that no such license shall be granted, unless;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
a translation of the work in the language mentioned in the application has 
not been published by the owner of the copyright in the work or any person 
authorized by him within one year of the first publication of the work, or if 
a translation has been so published, it has been out of print;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
the applicant has proved to the satisfaction of the Board that he had 
requested and had been denied authorization by the owner of the copyright 
to produce and publish such translation or that he was unable to find the 
owner of the copyright;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
where the applicant is unable to find the owner of the copyright he had sent 
a copy of his request for such authorization to the publisher whose name 
appears from the work not less than two months before the application for 
the license;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc: Omitted;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
an opportunity of being heard is given wherever practicable to the owner of 
the copyright in the work;

title: LICENSES
sect_desc: License to produce and publish translation
subsec_desc:
the Board is satisfied, for reason to be recorded in writing, that the grant of 
the license will be in the public interest.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Register of Copyrights, indexes form and inspection of Register
subsec_desc:
The Registrar shall keep at the Copyright Office a register in the prescribed form 
to be called the Register of Copyrights in which shall be entered the names or titles 
of works and the names and addresses of authors, publishers and owners of 
copyright and such other particulars as may be prescribed.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Register of Copyrights, indexes form and inspection of Register
subsec_desc:
The Registrar shall also keep such indexes of the Register of Copyrights as 
may be prescribed.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Register of Copyrights, indexes form and inspection of Register
subsec_desc:
The Register of Copyright and the indexes thereof kept under this section 
shall at all reasonable times be open to inspection, and any person shall be entitled 
to take copies, of or make extracts from, any such register or index on payment of 
such fee and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
subsec_desc:
The author or publisher of, or the owner 
of or other person interested in the copyright in, any work may make an 
application in the prescribed form accompanied by the prescribed fee to the 
Registrar for entering particulars of the work in the Register of Copyrights.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
subsec_desc:
On receipt of an application in respect of any work under subsection (1), 
the Registrar shall enter the particulars of the work in the Register of Copyrights 
and issue a certificate of such registration to the applicant unless, for reason to be 
recorded in writing, he considers that such entry should not be made in respect of 
any work; 
Provided that in the case of artistic works the Registrar shall not enter the 
particulars of the work in the Register of Copyrights and shall not issue a 
certificate of registration to the applicant unless within one month of the filing of 
the application, or within such extended time as the Registrar may determine, the 
applicant has advertised the work itself in a newspaper as may be prescribed, and 
send two copies thereof to the Registrar and unless within one month thereafter, or 
within such extended time as the Registrar may determined, not exceeding two 
months, the Registrar has not received  any objection to the registration of 
particulars of the work in the Register of Copyrights

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Registration of assignments, etc., of copyrights,
subsec_desc:
Any person 
interested in the grant of an interest in a copyright, either by assignment or license 
may make an application in the prescribed form, accompanied by the prescribed 
fee, the original instrument of such grant and a certified copy thereof, to the 
Registrar for entering the particulars of the grant in the Register of Copyrights.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Registration of assignments, etc., of copyrights,
subsec_desc:
On receipt of an application in respect of any work under subsection (1), 
the Registrar shall, after holding such inquiry as he deems fit, enter the particulars 
of the grant in the Register of Copyrights unless, for reasons to be recorded in 
writing, he considers that such entry should not be made in respect of any grant.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Registration of assignments, etc., of copyrights,
subsec_desc:
The certified copy of the grant shall be retained at the Copyright Office and 
the original shall be returned to the person depositing it, with a certificate of 
registration endorsed thereon or affixed thereto.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc:
The Registrar may in the prescribed cases and subject to the prescribed 
conditions, amend or alter the Register of Copyrights and the indexes by

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc: correcting any error in any name, address or particular; or

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc:
correcting any other error which may have arisen therein by 
accidental slip or omission.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc:
The Board, on application of the Registrar or of any person 
aggrieved, may order the rectification of the Register of Copyrights by-

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc:
the making of any entry wrongly omitted to be made in the 
Register, or

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc:
the expunging of any entry wrongly made in or, remaining on, the 
Register, or

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc: Correction of entries in the Register of Copyright and indexes,     etc.
subsec_desc: the correction of any error or defect in the Register.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Register of Copyrights to be prima facie evidence of particulars 
entered therein
subsec_desc:
The Register of Copyrights and the indexes shall be prima 
facie evidence of the particulars entered therein and documents purporting to be 
copies of any entry therein or extracts therefrom certified by the Registrar and 
sealed with the seal of the Copyright Office shall be admissible in evidence in all 
courts without further proof of production of the original.

title: REGISTRATION OF COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Register of Copyrights to be prima facie evidence of particulars 
entered therein
subsec_desc:
A certificate of registration of copyright in a work shall be prima 
facie evidence that copyright subsists in the work and that the person shown in the 
certificate as the owner of the copyright is the owner of such copyright.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
There shall be established for the purposes of this 
Ordinance an office to be called the Copyright Office.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The Copyright Office shall be under the immediate control of the 
Registrar of Copyrights who shall act under the superintendence and direction of 
the Central Government.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The Copyright Office shall have a seal the impression whereof shall 
be judicially noticed.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
There shall be established for the 
purpose of facilitating the registration of copyrights, a Branch of the Copyright 
Office at such place in Pakistan as the Registrar may. with the approval of the 
Federal Government, determine.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The Branch Office shall discharge such functions of the Copyright 
Office as may be notified by the Registrar from time to time.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
The 
Central 
Government shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, appoint a Registrar of 
Copyrights and may appoint one or more Deputy Registrars of Copyrights.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc: The Registrar shall,

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
sign all entries made in the Register of Copyrights kept 
under this Ordinance;

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
sign all certificates of registration of copyrights and certified 
copies under the seal of the Copyright Office;

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
exercise the powers conferred and perform the duties 
imposed upon him by or under this Ordinance;

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc: be the Secretary of the Copyright Board; and

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc: shall perform such other functions as may be prescribed.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
A Deputy Registrar of Copyrights shall discharge, under the 
superintendence and direction of the Registrar, such functions of the Registrar 
under this Ordinance as the Registrar may, from time to time, assign to him.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Registrar and Deputy Registrars of Copyrights
subsec_desc:
The Registrar may, with the approval of the Federal Government, 
assign any particular functions of the Registrar under this Ordinance to officers 
other than the Deputy Registrar of Copyrights.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The Central Government shall constitute a Board 
to be called the Copyright Board consisting of the following members, namely,

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc: a Chairman appointed by the Central Government;

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
not less than three and not more than five other members appointed 
by the Central Government after consultation with the 
representative bodies of authors, publishers, cinematograph industry 
and any other interest relating to copyright: 
Provided that adequate representation on the Board shall, as far as 
possible, be given to the resident of each Province; and

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc: the Registrar, ex-officio.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The members, including the Chairman of the Board, other than the ex
officio member, shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions 
as may be prescribed.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
subsec_desc:
The Chairman shall be a person who is, or has been a Judge of a High 
Court, or is qualified for appointment as such Judge.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
The Board shall subject to any 
rules that may be made under this Ordinance, have power to regulate its own 
procedure including the fixing of places and times of its sittings.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
If there is a difference of opinion among the members of the Board in 
respect of any matter coming before it for decision under this Ordinance, the 
opinion of the majority shall prevail: 
Provided that where there is no such majority the opinion of the Chairman 
shall prevail.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
The Board may authorize any of its members to exercise any of its powers 
under section 78 and any order made or act done in exercise of any such power by 
the member so authorized shall be deemed to be the order or act, as the case may 
be, of the Board.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
No act done or proceeding taken by the Board under this Ordinance shall 
by questioned on the ground merely of the existence of any vacancy in, or defect in 
the constitution of the Board.

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
The Board shall be deemed to be a civil court for the purposes of sections 
480 and 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, and all proceedings before 
the Board shall be deemed to be judicial proceedings within the meaning of 
sections 193 and 228 of Pakistan Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).

title:
COPYRIGHT OFFICE, REGISTRAR OF COPYRIGHTS  
AND COPYRIGHT BOARD
sect_desc: Powers and procedure of the Board
subsec_desc:
No member of the Board shall take part in any proceedings before the 
Board in respect of any matter in which he has a personal interest.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Delivery of books to public libraries
subsec_desc:
Subject to any rules that may 
be made under this Ordinance, but without prejudice to the provisions contained in 
section 40 of the Press and Publications Ordinance, 1960, the publisher of every 
book published in Pakistan after the commencement of this Ordinance shall, 
notwithstanding any agreement to the contrary, deliver at his own expense, one 
copy of the book to each of the "public libraries within thirty days from the date of 
its publication, and shall also furnish to it such particulars relating thereto as may 
be prescribed"

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Delivery of books to public libraries,
subsec_desc:
The copy delivered to the National Library of Pakistan, Islamabad shall be 
a copy of the whole book with all maps and illustrations belonging thereto finished 
and coloured in the same manner as the best copies of the same, and shall be 
bound, sewed or stitched together and on the best paper on which any copy of the 
book is printed.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Delivery of books to public libraries,
subsec_desc:
The copy delivered to any other public library shall be on the paper on 
which the largest number of copies of the book is printed for sale, and shall be in 
the like condition as the books prepared for sale.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Delivery of books to public libraries,
subsec_desc:
Nothing contained in sub-section (1), shall apply to any second or 
subsequent edition of a book in which edition no additions or alterations either in 
the letter press or in the maps, book prints or other engravings belonging to the 
book have been delivered under this section.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Delivery of periodicals and newspapers to public libraries
subsec_desc:
Subject to 
any rules that may be made under this Ordinance, but without prejudice to the 
provisions contained in section 36 of the Registration of Printing Press and 
Publication Ordinance, 1989 (VII of 1989), the publisher of every periodical or 
newspaper published in Pakistan shall deliver, at his own expense, one copy of 
each issue or such periodical or newspaper as soon as it is published to each of the 
public libraries, and shall also furnish to it such particulars relating thereto as may 
be prescribed.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Receipt for books, periodicals and newspapers delivered
subsec_desc:
The person 
in-charge of a public library (whether called a librarian or by any other name) or 
any other person authorized by him in this behalf to whom a copy of a book,  
periodical or a newspaper  is delivered under section 47 or Section 48, shall give to 
the publisher a receipt in writing thereto,

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
subsec_desc:
Any publisher who contravenes any provision of this Chapter or 
any rule made thereunder shall be punishable with fine which may extend to five 
hundred rupees and if the contravention is in respect of a book or a periodical shall 
also be publishable with fine which shall be equivalent to the value of the value of 
the book, or periodical and the Court trying the offense may direct that whole or 
any part of the fine realized from him shall be paid, by way of compensation, to 
the public library to which the book, periodical or newspaper, as the case may be, 
ought to have been delivered.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Cognizance of offense under this Chapter
subsec_desc:
No Court shall take 
cognizance of any offense punishable under this Chapter save no complaint made 
by an officer empowered in this behalf by the Central Government by a general or 
special order.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc: Cognizance of offense under this Chapter
subsec_desc:
No Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the first class shall try any 
offense punishable under this Chapter.

title:
DELIVERY OF BOOKS AND NEWSPAPERS 
TO PUBLIC LIBRARIES
sect_desc:
Application of this Chapter to books, periodicals and newspapers 
published by Government
subsec_desc:
This Chapter shall also apply to books, periodicals 
and newspapers published by or under the authority of the Government, but shall 
not apply to books or periodicals meant for official use only.

The Central

of the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply;-

subsec_desc:

like manner as if they were first published within Pakistan;

time of making of the work, subjects or citizens of a foreign country to

Pakistan;

and thereupon, subject to the provisions of this Chapter and of the order, this 
Ordinance shall apply accordingly:

title: INTERNATIONAL COPYRIGHT
sect_desc:
Power to restrict rights in works of foreign authors first published in 
Pakistan
subsec_desc:
If it appears to the Federal Government that a foreign country does 
not give or has not undertaken to give, adequate protection to the works of 
Pakistani authors, the Federal Government, by order published in the official 
Gazette, direct that such of the provisions of this Ordinance as confer copyright on 
works first published in Pakistan shall no apply to works,  published after the date 
specified in the order, the authors thereof  are subjects or citizens of such foreign 
country and or not domiciled in Pakistan, and thereupon those provisions shall not 
apply to such works

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT
subsec_desc:
Copyright in a work shall be deemed to be 
infringed:-

subsec_desc:
when any person without the consent of the owner of the copyright or 
without a license granted by such owner or the Registrar under this 
Ordinance or in contravention of the conditions of a license so granted or 
of any condition imposed by a competent authority under this Ordinance;-

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

conferred upon the owner of the copyright; or

subsec_desc:

in public where such performance constitutes an infringement of the 
copyright in the work unless he was not aware and had no reasonable 
ground for suspecting, that such performance would be an infringement 
of copyright, or

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT
subsec_desc: when any person:-

displays or offers for sale or hire, or

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

affect prejudicially the owner of the copyright, or

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

explanation:
For the purposes of this section, the reproduction of a literary, 
dramatic, musical or artistic work in the form of a cinematographic work shall be

near the lecture; but nothing in his clause shall affect the provisions as to 
newspaper summaries;

the publication  in a collection, mainly composed of non-copyright matter,

themselves published for the use of educational institutions, in which

Provided that not more than two such passages from works of the same 
author are published by the same published during any period of five years;

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

the reproduction or adaptation of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic

in the course and for the sole purpose of instruction whether at an

adaptation is made by a teacher or a pupil otherwise than by the use 
of a painting process;

the performance, in the course of the activities of an educational institution,

such reproduction;

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

the publication in a newspaper, magazine or other periodical of a report of

the making of not more than three copies of a book (including a pamphlet,

the reproduction, for the purpose of research or private study or with a view

a library, museum or other institution to which the public has access: 
Provided that where the identity of the author of any such work, or in the 
case of a work of joint authorship, of any of the authors, is known to the 
library, museum or other institution, as the case may be, the provision of 
this clause shall apply only if such reproduction is made at a time more 
than fifty years from the date of the death of the author or, in the case of a 
work of joint authorship, from the death of the author whose identity is 
known or, if the identity of more authors than whose identity is known or,

agent and on payment of the prescribed fee, may, after making such inquiry as he 
deems fit, order that copies made out of Pakistan

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT

Subject to any rules that may be made under this Ordinance, the Registrar 
or any person authorized by him in this behalf may enter any ship, vehicle, dock or 
premises where any such copies as are referred to in sub-section(1)may be found 
and may examine such copies.

title: INFRINGEMENT OF COPYRIGHT
